title: Tagine
subtitle: Traditional Moroccan Dish
description: Tagine is a slow-cooked stew made with meat, vegetables, and aromatic spices. It is typically cooked in a clay pot called a tagine and served with couscous.

title: Harira
subtitle: Traditional Moroccan Soup
description: Harira is a hearty soup made with tomatoes, lentils, chickpeas, and a blend of spices. It is often enjoyed during Ramadan as a starter to break the fast.

title: Couscous
subtitle: Moroccan Staple Dish
description: Couscous is a staple in Moroccan cuisine. It is made from semolina grains and typically served with a variety of vegetables, meat, and a flavorful sauce.

title: Pastilla
subtitle: Traditional Moroccan Pastry
description: Pastilla is a savory pastry filled with a mixture of meat, eggs, and spices. It is typically topped with powdered sugar and cinnamon and served as a special dish during festive occasions.

title: Msemen
subtitle: Moroccan Pancake
description: Msemen is a traditional Moroccan pancake made from a dough of flour, semolina, and oil. It is typically served with honey or jam for breakfast or as a snack.

title: Zaalouk
subtitle: Moroccan Eggplant Dip
description: Zaalouk is a flavorful dip made from roasted eggplant, tomatoes, garlic, and a blend of spices. It is typically served as an appetizer with bread or as a side dish.

title: Briouats
subtitle: Moroccan Stuffed Pastries
description: Briouats are crispy pastries filled with a variety of ingredients such as meat, cheese, or vegetables. They are typically served as an appetizer or snack.

title: Mint Tea
subtitle: Traditional Moroccan Drink
description: Mint tea, also known as Moroccan tea or Maghrebi mint tea, is a traditional drink in Moroccan culture. It is made with green tea, fresh mint leaves, and sugar.

title: Mrouzia
subtitle: Traditional Moroccan Dish
description: Mrouzia is a sweet and savory dish made with lamb, honey, almonds, and a blend of spices. It is typically served during festive occasions such as Eid al-Adha.

title: Chebakia
subtitle: Moroccan Sesame Cookies
description: Chebakia is a traditional Moroccan cookie made from a dough of flour, sesame seeds, honey, and a blend of spices. It is typically enjoyed during Ramadan.

title: Makouda
subtitle: Moroccan Potato Fritters
description: Makouda is a popular street food in Morocco. It is made from mashed potatoes mixed with spices, formed into patties, and deep-fried until crispy.
